Entities.Name: Wound Type
Entities.Definition: Classification of the wound based on its nature and characteristics.

Sample Data.Sentence: The patient was treated for a pressure ulcer stage II on the lower back.
Sample Data.Annotated: Wound Type: Pressure ulcer stage II

Entities.Name: Pressure Ulcer Stage
Entities.Definition: The specific stage of a pressure ulcer, detailing the severity from I to IV.

Sample Data.Sentence: Pressure ulcer stage III was noted on the patient's heel.

Entities.Name: Wound Size
Entities.Definition: The dimensions of the wound (length, depth, width) as noted in clinical assessments.

Sample Data.Sentence: Wound measures 5 cm by 3 cm on the patient's left arm.

Entities.Name: Anatomic Location
Entities.Definition: The specific body part or area where the wound is located.

Sample Data.Sentence: Observed a surgical incision on the anterior aspect of the abdomen.

Entities.Name: Wound Treatment
Entities.Definition: Details regarding the treatment administered for the wound.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient received wound care with daily dressing changes and application of topical antibiotics.
Sample Data.Annotated: Wound Treatment: daily dressing changes, topical antibiotics

Dataset.Name: Clinical Notes Dataset
Dataset.Details: A dataset of 360 training and 1,100 test clinical notes, including discharge summaries and outpatient notes, annotated for wound-related information.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The annotation process involved manual review by domain experts who identified wound cases and annotated them according to a pre-defined schema based on common wound characteristics.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: No direct link provided in the paper for the annotation guidelines.
